message: Bob, I'm confident that this product would be a valuable asset for your company.  I'm offering it to you at a price of $950,000. This represents a significant opportunity for you to acquire a product that can drive substantial returns.  Let's discuss further.
Thank you for considering my company's needs. While I appreciate the value of the product, I believe we can reach a more mutually beneficial agreement. I propose a price of $820,000 for the product.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but I need to be closer to my desired price point to make this deal work.  I'm willing to come down to $900,000.  This still offers you a great opportunity to acquire a product that will significantly benefit your company. Let's work together to finalize this deal.

I understand your position, Alice. I've reviewed our previous discussions and am willing to increase my offer to $875,000. I hope this proposal will lead us closer to reaching an agreement that benefits both of our companies.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  Let's split the difference.  I'm offering the product for $887,500. This is a fair price that reflects the value of the product and allows both of us to walk away satisfied. Let's close this deal.
